It will be good to do this. However we should also take into consideration for future about placing replicas based on load on pinot-servers as well. Rack awareness should be not prohibit us from doing a load balancer type of feature in the future.
LGTM.

Nicely done
lgtm
lgtm
In this case, the queries are select + filtering.
Does that mean broker will act as pass through i.e  it just concatenates the responses from the servers.
Yes, broker will merge data from all the servers then send back, but this may eat too much memory for a single query.

We should support cursor for this use case. We can still compress responses
but cursors will keep brokers simple and we don't pay all the processing
cost upfront.

On Thu, Aug 25, 2016 at 5:37 PM, Xiang Fu notifications@github.com wrote:

> Yes, broker will merge data from all the servers then send back, but this
> may eat too much memory for a single query.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/linkedin/pinot/issues/399#issuecomment-242588342, or mute
> the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABAmRnLtBkXn10IWreGuL59VeXQzymtAks5qjjUwgaJpZM4JlC3A
> .
@antumbde can you elaborate on the solution. I get the cursor part from client but how would it work between broker and server.

For simple select + filter, we don't need scatter-gather. We can let only
one server process at a time and return compressed response that are passed
through broker. This works for simple select, filter, project queries.

That doesn't work for group-by. But, reading large datasets with group-by
is lower probability use case.

@ Xiang Fu : Is this for presto plugin ? Is the limitation mentioned above
a problem for your use case ?
-Adwait

On Thu, Aug 25, 2016 at 5:44 PM, Kishore Gopalakrishna <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @antumbde https://github.com/antumbde can you elaborate on the
> solution. I get the cursor part from client but how would it work between
> broker and server.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/linkedin/pinot/issues/399#issuecomment-242589313, or mute
> the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABAmRk4LXl8W95Kp-Ru5TLQTuwqoriJgks5qjjb1gaJpZM4JlC3A
> .

Yes, for presto mostly and I need to get this cursor feature in java client implementation. 
My feeling is it's fine to do so as broker could choose when to push down the request to a server.
Also I'm thinking is it possible to write intermediate query response to disk on broker and mmap them for merger or stream out.

I'll add the unit test for `SortedInvertedIndexBasedFilterOperator` in another PR, no other filter operator has a matching unit test and some of the plumbing to make this test readable is missing (eg. most of `DataSourceUtils` is commented out and defunct, see [the latest revision of DataSourceUtils](https://github.com/linkedin/pinot/blob/7c90c763c069f6f7b8db1756158805eb8e7655d5/pinot-core/src/test/java/com/linkedin/pinot/util/datasource/DataSourceUtils.java))
lgtm. We should remember to add an integration test that deletes and recreates realtime tables in the future, to make sure this scenario works properly.
lgtm

Pinot does not have support for sketches as of now. Its work in progress.

topN is supported, by default group by aggregation query in Pinot always
does topN N=10 by default.

Yes, you use top N to limit the rows returned by group By.
